resources.string:
HELP - List Panel Screen

This screen displays list of players on the current panel. The name of the panel is displayed at the top of the screen. (If panel name is null use the the rename panel to assign a name.)

Touch + to add a new player to the current panel

Swipe up and down to scroll if list extends off end of screen

Touch on a player row to see and / or edit player details

LongPress a player row to get options to:
1. delete player
2. make phone call to player
3. send text to player

Drop Down Menu
• new panel creates a new panel. Enter the name.
• change panel changes to another entered panel.
• rename panel changes the name of a panel. Select the panel you want to rename and enter a new name
• delete panel select panel to delete
• import panel load a saved panel from storage
• export panel save the current panel to the device (panels are stored in a directory named match_BU)

Importing existing panels
if you have an existing panel (in a spreadsheet for example), format it as a csv file to import it to the app. The easist way to get the correct format is to examine an exported file.

touch back button to return to previous screen.

HELP - Create / Edit Player Screen

Enter player details here.

You must enter a Nickname as a minimum to be able to Save a player. Other fields are optional. The Nickname must be between 3 and 6 characters long.

Touch Save to create a new player or save edits to an existing player.

HELP - Review Screens

View list of match statistics

LongPress a row to get options to delete it

Touch Save to create a new player or save edits to an existing player.

HELP - Training Attendance Screen

Enter date, location and any comments here.

Touch the select players present button to display a list of players on the panel. Touch the checkboxes beside each player to record their attendance. Swipe/Scroll to see full list if necessary. Click OK when finished.

A list of selected players will be displayed on return.

Touch the select players present button again to add or remove players from the list

Touch save players to save the list of attending players to the database.

Touch review attendance by player to get a summary of attendance for each player at each training training session. Note that your device must be able to open csv files.

Touch email attendance to save and email the attendance summary. The summary will be saved and emailed as a csv file called training_summary.csv

list of training sessions
Touch on a row/date to see details for that specific training session.
Long press on a row/date to delete details of a specific training session.

HELP - Start Screen

This App allows you to:
• to store contact details for a panel of players
• to record attendance at training
• time and keep score for a hurling/camogie match
• record team and player performance stastics
• review summary and details statistics
• email statistics in a csv format which can be opened in spreadsheet software for more detailed analysis later

help
Touch ? in menu bar at the top to get help in any screen.

manage panel
Touch to see lists of players and contact details.

manage training
Touch to record attendance at training.

start new match
All match related data - timer/scores/statistics - is deleted/reset and a new match setup will begin.

Panel details and the team lineup from the previous match are retained.

continue existing match
What it says!. All current match data is retained.

save / email match data
match and statitics data for the current match is backed up to device storage and can be emailed.
Files stored/emailed are:
• shots.csv
• frees.csv
• puckouts.csv
• positions.csv
The .csv files can be opened with spreadsheet software

quit
quit app. No data is deleted.

touch back button to return to previous screen.

HELP - SETUP screen

This screen is used to enter match details, and make/save team selection.

By default, the team selection from the last match is retained so you can edit it rather than start from scratch. To clear the team selection long press the reset team button.

You select 15 players and up to 10 subs.

Enter Date, Opposition Team name and Location at top of the screen. Own team name defaults to the current panel name. To change it go into the manage panel section.

To select the team, touch on one of the position buttons. This will display a list of players on your panel. Swipe/scroll, if necessary, to see all players and touch one to select. Repeat for all the positions and subs.

It is not necessary to select a player for all or any of the positions, you can just leave the number if you prefer.

When you are finished, touch the save starting team button to save the starting lineup.

You can only save starting team once. You will get a message if you try again. Quit back out to start screen and start new match again if you want to enter a new team selection.

To make a postion change or substitution use the -SWAP- item in the panel list. For example: to substitute the goalkeeper:
• touch the goalkeeper position button and select -SWAP- from the list of players.
•This will remove the goalkeepers name onto the list of players and insert -SWAP- into the team lineup.
•Then touch on the button of the sub you want to use.
•Select the goalkeepers name from the list of players.
•This will remove the subs name onto the list of players and swap in the goalkeepers name as the sub.
• Now touch on the goalkeeper position button and select the subs name from the list of players.
• This will swap the subs name into the team line up and remove -SWAP- to the list of players again.
•touch the make change button to save the change.

The same procedure applies to making postion changes - swap in -SWAP- to take a player out, swap that player into their new position, put the player swapped out of that position back into the first position instead of -SWAP- and touch the make change button to save the change.

After making a substitution or position change, touch the make change button to save the changes.

swipe screen or touch tab at top to change to RECORD or REVIEW screens.

touch back button to return to Start screen.

HELP - RECORD screen

TIMER SECTION
Touch the mins/half button to set how long the match will be. You can do this while the timer is running if you forget to do it at the start.
Touch the start button to start the match timer. Screen will update with start time, time gone and time left in the half.
You can touch the - and + to adjust the time by 30 secs if necessary while the timer is running.
Touch stop to end the first half and start again to commence the second half.

Touching stop at the end of each half also saves the score and start times to the database.

SCORE SECTION
Touch the goals and points buttons to increment the scores.
Touch the - and + buttons to decrement the scores.

RESET SECTION
Long touch to reset match timer and/or score and/or stats.

RECORD STATS SECTION
In this section you can record info/statistics pertaining to shots, frees and puck outs for your own team and the opposition. Own team always refers to the team on the left of the screen

Touch the shot / free / puck out buttons to record stats. The values you have selected will be displayed in red. Touch the commit button to save the chosen values or the shot / free / puck out buttons again to change your selection.

1. Shots
You can record:
• shot outcome
• shot type
• for your own team, the player name who took shot
• for opposition team, the player number who took shot
• zone on pitch from where shot was taken. (Note your own goal is always at the bottom of screen with opposition on top.)

2. Frees
You can record:
• reason for free
• zone on pitch where free was awarded
• for your own team, which player, if applicable, was fouled.
• for opposition team, if applicable, which of your own players was responsible for giving away the free


3. Puck Outs
You can record:
• puck out outcome
• zone on pitch where puck out was won or lost
• for your own team, which player, if applicable, won or lost the puck out

Touch undo last stats entry to delete the last stats entry if you made an error. You can delete up to the 4 most recent entries.

swipe screen or touch tabs at top to change to SETUP or REVIEW screens.

touch back button to return to Start screen.

HELP - REVIEW screen

The review screen presents a summary of recorded statistics for the current match.

In the shots and puckouts section the numbers are as a percentage for each team.

In the free setion the numbers are as a percentage of the total frees awared in the match.

The review shots, review frees and review puckouts buttons display a detailed list of all data / statistics recorded.

touch back button to return to Start screen.
